page.title: 15Mr.Harold Walker.
page.content: The{deputy speaker}is{elected}by the {Members of Parliament.}Mr.Walker was asked by the{leader of the House}and the{chief whip}if he would take on the job.He accepted and the House voted to appoint him. Since his election in {June 1983}Mr.Walker has been present every working day in the House.He has a{daily conference}with{the speaker.} Many years ago when there was only one speaker he was not allowed to leave the chair so if he needed the toilet they drew a canopy round the chair and gave him a chamber pot!If the Members of Parliament get{rowdy}it is the speakers job to keep them in order.He shouts{order,order,}speaks personally to the Members of Parliament and if all else fails he suspends the House till tempers cool.
